Articles.Content:
Explosions are one of the most funny things in the game since its early releases, but looking closely to them, it seems to me that they're a little too feebles, respect to Real Life:

I would like to know if it's possible for @SQUAD or modders, to make explosions bigger and more impressives.
Agreed, in some cases the explosions in KSP are smaller than the tanks themselves. They should be massive as you have pointed out.
They should be bigger. Not only are they realistic, but they are also much more Kerbal

Yeah, when any fuel tank with LFO explodes, they can just stop the physics calculations for all the parts on the rocket, and instead just render the giant explosion. The parts stopped existing anyway.
Didn't there use to be an "awesome" value in settings.config that controlled that?
Marce used to have the Blast Awesomeness Modifier mod, I don't know if anyone picked it up since Marce sadly left however

Strange. I thought, the aim of a rocket construction is to avoid explosions, so you should never see them if doing right... My mistake.

And for real life, trusses and other dumb things would not explode, but just peacefully turn into dust and disppear. Otherwise it looks strange when a piece of metal falls from 1 km and explodes.

And green blood.

Edited November 16, 2016 by kerbiloid

I would go so far to suggest the introduction of shockwaves. Generated by a large enough explosion from a huge enough rocket would obliterate nearby buildings like the VAB or vessels that are nearby.

^^Honestly, lets get serious about this.

Explosions in KSP are too big in many cases.  If I drop a structural fuselage from a low flying plane, the empty, aluminum tube explodes with a fireball.  Perhaps explosions should be dependent on parts or LFO content at a given time?  This may be challenging to actually accomplish, though.
I fully support the idea of adding more realism when it comes in the form of bigger explosions.
Flaming, leaking seals that lead to a progressive explosion would be cool.

Just now, Jonfliesgoats said:

Flaming, leaking seals that lead to a progressive explosion would be cool.

*looks at N1*

I definitely second this. But as some others have said, along with this, the explosiveness of inert parts like non-fueled wings, trusses, and other structural parts should be effectively eliminated. The only time those parts should get anything looking like an explosion is when colliding with something at >1km/s (possibly even more than that).
